short_summary: Procurement of a complete gas chromatography system
description: The procurement involves buying a complete gas chromatography system for the department of the Royal Military College of Canada's chemistry and chemical engineering department located in Kingston, Ontario.
full_summary:
# Tender Notice
## W0114-220006 Gas Chromatograph

## Solicitation Information

*   Solicitation Number: WS3793753736
*   Reference Number: WS3793753736
*   Amendment Number: 0

## Procurement Information

*   **Request for Proposal (RFP) Notice**
    The Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC), on behalf of the Department of National Defence (DND), invites offers from qualified suppliers to provide a complete gas chromatography system.
*   **Technical Specifications**
    The successful offeror must provide a complete gas chromatography system, as described in the solicitation document.
*   **Commercial Information**
    The contract term is expected to begin on January 20, 2023, and end on May 31, 2023.
*   **Tender Status**
    The tender is closed.

## Geographic Scope

*   The contract will be delivered to DND in Kingston, Ontario, Canada.
*   The contract may be subject to the Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement (CKFTA) and the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA).

## Trade Agreements

*   Offers from foreign companies can be considered if they are eligible under a trade agreement.

## Contact Information

*   Contracting Authority:
    *   Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC)
    *   11 Laurier St, Phase III, Place du Portage, Gatineau, QC, K1A 0S5
*   Procurement Specialist:
    *   Darlene Keenan (elle-la / she-her)
    *   darlene.keenan@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca

## Notice Information

*   Publication Date: December 16, 2022
*   Closing Date: January 18, 2023 at 14:00:00 (local time)
*   Notice URL: <http://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/14918323?extsite=MTQ5MTgzMjNfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==>

The original file contained templates using common naming conventions (e.g., `**title-titre-eng**`). Sticking to these conventions significantly streamlines data management, facilitates the analysis and merging of information from different sources,
